Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think there’s any such thing as this has happened to me; therefore, I should film this. I don’t believe that’s good enough to make a movie out of. If I make a movie out of something that happened to me, I really want it to cross in with something

A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial London, she faces racism, sexism, and D-day celebrations – the intersection of class, racial, and gender lines are limned in this quite readable novel.
I feel the horse and all the incidents are great. Other than that, not a great amount of depthness is developed for other characters.

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a savage cry against the Japanese war history in juxtaposition with weakness, sins, good humors and innocence of the illustrator himself.<|end_of_text|>

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and Noble Johnson with enough bad guys to necessitate the terms "Calico Kid" and "Spaniards dishonorably slain," this film has everything from fistfights to fistfights with snakes! A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, whom Alice is going to kill, comes back as a vampire, has 3 nasty friends, and they all go on the rampage until the boy throws a holy cross at the vampire and it explodes. Now, Alice is a vampire, and she must euthanize her own cat.
